info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 19 at 6:24PM EDT until May 19 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Madison County in western North Carolina... Northeastern Buncombe County in western North Carolina... West central Yancey County in western North Carolina... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 624 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles east of Marshall, or 4 miles south of Mars Hill, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Weaverville, B.R. Parkway-East Asheville To Craggy Gardens, Barnardsville, Flat Creek and Mars Hill. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Brief damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines over small areas. A brief period of large hail is also possible. Seek shelter inside an interior room. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
